item.title: ::obj command Help?
item.dc:creator: @Christiaan Christiaan
item.description:
@Christiaan wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“object”) && playerRights >= 2) {
try
{
int newOBJ = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7));

	makeGlobalObject(absX,absY, newOBJ, 0, 10);

sM(“You spawn an object”);
} catch(Exception e) {
sM(“Wrong Syntax! Use as ::object 1”);
}} [/code]

Easy, idk if it works, if its not working… say it than i can help.

Read full topic

item.title: ::obj command Help?
item.dc:creator: @riri383 riri383
item.description:
@riri383 wrote:

This is my ::obj command and I need to know what dir is

        if (command.startsWith("obj") && playerRights >  2) {
            String[] args = command.split(" ");
            if (args.length == 3) {
                int objid = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);//object id
                int dir = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);//help
                int dax = absX;//tox
                int day = absY;//toy
                commandobject(objid, dax, day, dir);
                sM("Object number " + objid + " now spawns at " + absX + "-" + absY + "");

            } else {
                sM("Oops! Use as ::obj 213 1-2-3-0");
            }
        }

I know the other ints, (objID, dir???, tox, toy) Help?

Read full topic
